Common_PaymasterObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

Common_PaymasterObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Common_PaymasterObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

description: The Common Paymaster ID that Workday generates.

Common_Paymaster_Data.description: Enter an ID or Workday will generate one. You'll use this ID when editing this Common Paymaster.

validation.validation: Select an Inactive as-of Quarter that's not already configured for this state on another row: [inactive quarter]; [state].
Select a Start Quarter that's not within the effective quarters of another row for the same state: [start quarter entered]; [duplicate state].
Select a Start Quarter that's before the Inactive as-of Year: [inactive as of year].
Select an Inactive as-of Quarter that's after the Start Quarter: [start quarter].
Select an Inactive as-of Quarter that's not within the effective quarters of another row for the same state: [inactive quarter]; [state].
Select an Inactive as-of Quarter that's within or after the Reporting Tax Year: [reporting tax year].
Select an Inactive as-of Quarter that's before the second quarter of the Inactive as-of Year: [inactive tax year].
Select a Start Quarter that's not already configured for this state: [start quarter]; [state].
Enter a Start Quarter on the state configuration that's within the effective dates for the payroll state authorities on the Company State and Local US Tax Reporting for the Common Paymaster company.
Select a Start Quarter that's within or after the Reporting Tax Year: [reporting tax year]
A state can't be active on more than one row. Inactivate the duplicate row, or select a different state: [duplicate state].
You can't have a gap between quarters for this state. Select a Start Quarter that's equal to the Inactive as-of Quarter on the previous row for this state and tax year: [inactive quarter]; [state].
Enter a Start Quarter that's on or after Q1 2021.

Common_Paymaster_Data.description: Select 'y' to generate a separate year-end form for each company in the company relationship.

validation.validation: Select an Inactive as-of Tax Year that's after the Reporting Tax Year: [reporting tax year].
The common paymaster company can't be a related company.
You can't delete this related company because you already ran payroll: [company].

This Common Paymaster ID already exists and you selected the Add Only check box. Overwrite the data on the existing Common Paymaster relationship by deselecting the Add Only check box. Or, create a new Common Paymaster relationship by leaving the Add Only check box selected and entering a unique ID.
This Reference ID is used by another Common Paymaster relationship. Enter a unique ID.
You can't add a related company because W-2s exist for this Common Paymaster relationship.
Select a Reporting Tax Year that's on or after 2021.
You can’t select that Inactive as-of Tax Year because you already ran payroll within the common paymaster effective dates: [company].
You can't delete this Common Paymaster company because you already ran payroll: [company].
You can't select that Reporting Tax Year because W-2s exist for that year.
This company is already in an active company relationship. You can't include it in a Common Paymaster relationship.
You must select separate for periodic and quarterly tax filing.
You can't delete this state from the state configuration because you already ran payroll for the effective quarters: [companies].
You can't change the year end form configuration because W-2s exist for this Common Paymaster relationship. Cancel the existing W-2s, or end the existing relationship and create a new one.
You can't change the Reporting Tax Year because W-2s exist for that year.
You can’t select that Inactive as-of Tax Year because W-2s exist within the Common Paymaster effective dates.
You can't delete the Inactive as-of Tax Year because you already have payroll results for that year, which are outside the effective dates for the common paymaster relationship: [company].
